engineering_design_principles.mechanism: The outer layer is designed to act as a sacrificial barrier and absorbent layer, protecting the inner components from external threats such as interstellar objects and cosmic radiation.
The theoretical spherical formation of icy bodies provides a large protective zone, dissipating and deflecting external threats before they reach the inner region where planets reside.
The collective gravitational forces of icy bodies within the protective structure can attract and capture incoming objects, further enhancing the protective function of this structure.
